I sent this awesome carrier to space

Well I was going to Dres, but the game decided to go technicolor on me.

Oooh! 1.0.5 is out.
I downloaded 1.0.5 and played around with planes a bit.

After upgrading to 1.0.5, I spent my evening reading through the patch notes, and looking through some diffs of GameData/Squad, building a list of things I need to revise in my mods. It's now a freakin' laundry list. But it's manageable.
I downloaded 1.05 and started a new career. I like it so far!

After completing a contract to test a decoupler in a splashed-down situation (I LOVE the new contacts!), Val discovered it worked as a rocket jetskii.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

...It didn't work for very LONG, but it did manage 88.2 m/s (171 knots)!
Just woke up and read here about 1.0.5 so I went on and made a backup of my 1.0.4 install before I manage to destroy something by launching Steam and auto update does its job.

I decided that I do not continue my break until 1.1. However, I will wait couple of weeks that at least most significant mods (Mechjeb, TAC-LS, KAS, Scansat, Outer Planets etc.) will be updated. Stock game is just too boring.
I also got a World First for diving to 750m underwater. Who knew that jet intakes could use water instead of air?
Downloaded and installed 1.0.5. Along with about eight zillion other Kerbonauts.
Made a SSSTO (Seaplane SSTO)
Slowly and quietly starting a fresh new carreer, testing new stuff as i unlock them ,'')

Yesterday afternoon like so many of you I downloaded KSP v.1.0.5, thus beginning the long slog for mod updates. I won't switch over from 1.0.2 (yeah, I never upgraded to 1.0.4) until I can confirm they're all working.

So that brought me to last night. I began by planning for the evening with a check of the two Kerbin rescue contracts I had on the block - both were in low orbits below 85k - as well as a check of the maximum compliment of the Kerbinport space station (sixteen, with seven Kerbals aboard at the beginning of the night). With that information in hand, I fueled the Project Peacock craft docked at the station and rescued Calster, a pilot, and returned him to Kerbinport. I then loaded scientists Nina, Nedcas, Lagerette, Granie and Seandard along with tourist Hilliana aboard a Raven 7b spaceplane and sent them to Kerbinport as well. Rendezvous and docking was a success, though the Raven arrived a little lower on gas than I would've preferred. Nina joined Bob in the lab and the remaining scientists were offloaded into the station's habitation module, jumping the lab's sci production rate up to about 2.6 sci per day; still low, but higher than it was. Calster was loaded as a passenger on the Raven, as was Valentina; Gwezny was placed in the craft's cockpit (Val's still in hack for crashing a Raven and killing a bunch of tourists a while back, even though it was the due to the machinations of the Q continuum throwing the laws of physics out the window (read: FAR crashed on me that night and I hit quicksave instead of quickload)). After doing some calculations, I sent the Peacock out again to pick up Stellie, a scientist, from Kerbin orbit. The rescue was a success and the craft successfully returned to Kerbinport despite running out of fuel - the craft's got overpowered RCS capabilities, and it turned out to be a good thing. Stellie was loaded as a passenger on the Raven. Finally, the Raven was loaded with some truly precious cargo - Bob's thirty experiments that he conducted on his last trip to Mun. The plane was rigged for a return flight to KSC at the tail end of the evening, and the flight is scheduled to take place first thing next time I play the game.

Enola Gay returns to Kerbin from Minmus in five hours, after which I've got plans to send a batch of tourists into solar orbit. At this point I need to send up more fuel for Kerbinport. Still haven't landed the Vulture plane from the last fueling mission - I really oughta get onto that sometime soon. In fact, I've got a lot of plane flying in my near future: Land the Raven, Land the Vulture, send up a Magpie (which still hasn't been fully tested) to dock with a craft in orbit to haul down to the surface, and get the damn Albatross refueling plane working or send up another Vulture. All planes. All very very soon...especially if I want to start a new career save.

Had fun with thrust reversers and Goliaths, and made my first jet in 1.0.5: the "Reverso":

Last picture was taken at 400+ m/s
